message_1: What products will be formed when potassium iodide (KI) and lead(II) nitrate (Pb(NO3)2) undergo a double replacement reaction? Write the balanced chemical equation and identify the state of each compound.
message_2:
When potassium iodide (KI) and lead(II) nitrate (Pb(NO3)2) undergo a double replacement reaction, the products formed will be potassium nitrate (KNO3) and lead(II) iodide (PbI2). The balanced chemical equation for this reaction is:

2 KI (aq) + Pb(NO3)2 (aq) â†’ 2 KNO3 (aq) + PbI2 (s)

In this equation, (aq) represents the aqueous state, meaning the compound is dissolved in water, and (s) represents the solid state. So, potassium iodide and lead(II) nitrate are both in aqueous states, while potassium nitrate is in an aqueous state and lead(II) iodide is in a solid state.
